intro: Xylopia decaryana, commonly known as the African bitter almond, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Annonaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces small, hard, aromatic fruits that contain several seeds. Its bark and leaves have been traditionally used in herbal medicine for their purported medicinal properties. The plant's botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and ethnobotanical contexts.
